page.title: 09The Army in Tilshead
page.content: I see the Army when I pass the ranges on my way to school each day. At school sometimes I hear guns and tanks. On the range they have tanks, helicopters and planes. If you see a red flag flying it means they are doing an exercise. It is dangerous on the range. If you find things on the range they might be live ammunition and could explode. When bombs go off they shake the school windows and sometimes keep awake in the night. Sometimes you can see flares. The tall masts are called dipoles and are used to send radio messages. The army call the messages 'signals'. The big guns use areas called{artillery ranges.}The nearby woods and trees give the soldiers practice in jungle warfare.
